### Quarto extensions and features


| Link | Description |
|---------|:-----|
| [Shinylive Quarto extension](https://github.com/quarto-ext/shinylive){.external} | This extension lets you embed Shinylive applications in a Quarto document. These are Shiny for Python applications which run completely in the browser, using Pyodide (Python compiled to WebAssembly). |
| [Font Awesome](https://mine-cetinkaya-rundel.github.io/quarto-tip-a-day/posts/18-font-awesome/){.external} | Including Font Awesome icons in Quarto documents is now easy peasy lemon squeezy {{< fa lemon >}}  with the Font Awesome extension. Just surround the Font Awesome icon name in ``{{< and >}}``. |
| [Font Awesome Search](https://fontawesome.com/search){.external} | The easiest way to get icons on your website is with a Kit. It's your very own custom version of Font Awesome, all bundled up with only the icons, tools, and settings you need.  |
| [Github Actions for Quarto](https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-actions){.external} |  This repository stores Github Actions useful for building and publishing Quarto documents. |
| [HTML blocks and embed iframe](https://mine-cetinkaya-rundel.github.io/quarto-tip-a-day/posts/12-html-block/){.external} |  Want to embed an iframe on a webpage or a slide deck? Plop the sharing code in a raw html block! |
| [Listing contents](https://mine-cetinkaya-rundel.github.io/quarto-tip-a-day/posts/06-listing-contents/){.external} | Listings enable you to automatically generate the contents of a page (or region of a page) from a list of Quarto documents or other custom data.  |
| [Lightbox](https://github.com/quarto-ext/lightbox){.external} | An extension that uses the GLightbox javascript library to add lightbox styling and behavior to images in your HTML documents.  |
